content.title: Upcoming Presentations
description: Virtual Isolation: Is Hyperconnectivity Helping or Harming the Legal Professional?

Recent studies have shown that there has been a dramatic increase in impairment due to alcoholism, addiction, and mental health disorders among members of the legal profession. What role does an always-connected society and technology play in this phenomenon? Explore this question in our upcoming webinar led by Brian S. Quinn of Lawyers Concerned for Lawyers of Pennsylvania. Please note this webinar is approved for one hour of California Competence Issues MCLE credit.

content.title: Recent Recordings
description: 2023-2024 Supreme Court Term Preview

As we begin what promises to be another eventful U.S. Supreme Court Term, Justia Webinars is proud to present our 2023-2024 Supreme Court Term preview! Stream this on-demand California CLE program in which UC Davis Law Professor Vikram Amar and Cornell Law School Professor Michael Dorf discuss some of the leading cases on the Court’s current docket. Please note the on-demand version of this program is approved for one hour of General MCLE credit in California.
Professionalism in the Age of Social Media: Relevance, Reliability, and Referability on LinkedIn

Want to get insights that may just be the catalyst for change in your practice? LinkedIn offers a great tool for lawyers seeking new contacts and professional recognition. We invite you to watch this on-demand webinar in which attorney Andy Brownstein and LinkedIn trainer and consultant Marc W. Halpert share their tips and tricks for maximizing LinkedIn for success.

content.title: Upcoming Webinars
description: ​Practice Law With AI (Without Losing Your Law License)

Should lawyers steer clear of AI tools? If lawyers understand the technological limitations of AI and their professional responsibilities, AI tools have the potential to greatly benefit their practice. RSVP to this webinar in which attorneys and Justia Team members Kara Simon and Marina Wilson discuss some of the ins and outs of using AI in your practice.

content.title: Recent Recordings
description: ​Supreme Court 2022-23 Term in Review

Another eventful U.S. Supreme Court Term is in the books and Justia Webinars proudly presented our 2022-2023 term in review. Stream Illinois Law Dean and Professor Vikram Amar and Cornell Law School Professor Michael Dorf’s discussion of some of the leading cases and issues decided in the most recent SCOTUS term.
Requests and Forms as Modern as the Evidence You Seek

Are your discovery requests still mired in a bygone world of telegrams and carbon paper? Are you getting pummeled with expenses and review challenges you need not accept? In this on-demand webinar, e-discovery expert Craig Ball discusses ways to revamp your requests to target electronic evidence and protect your bottom line in the modern world.
